hint.text: Try converting all the variables in terms of one single variable.

solution.text:
Given that :
z is _{{2*k}}_ times of x, thus z = _{{2*k}}_x
Similarly, y = _{k}_x
Therefore, We get the dimension as :
i.e., a = 2x, b = _{{2*k}}_x and c = _{{2*k}}_x
We know :
Semi-perimeter, s = \(a+b+c\over 2\)
i.e, s = _{{((2+2*k+2*k)/2)*j}}_ = \(2x + _{{2*k}}_x + _{{2*k}}_x\over 2\)
i.e,\(_{{2+4*k}}_x\) = _{{(2+4*k)*j}}_
i.e., x = _{j}_
So we get the dimensions of the triangle as :
a = _{{2*j}}_, b = _{{2*k*j}}_ and c = _{{2*k*j}}_
Using Heron's formula :
Area = \(\sqrt{s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}\)
Area = \(\sqrt{_{{(2+4*k)*j/2}}_(_{{(2+4*k)*j/2}}_-_{{2*j}}_)(_{{(2+4*k)*j/2}}_-_{{2*j*k}}_)(_{{(2+4*k)*j/2}}_-_{{2*j*k}}_)}\)
Area = \(\sqrt{_{{(1+2*k)*j}}_(_{{(-1+2*k)*j}}_)(_{j}_)(_{j}_)}\)
Area = _{{j*j}}_\(\sqrt{_{{4*k*k-1}}_}\)

content.text: Pramod, an engineer wants to design a solar panel as shown below with dimension 2x, 2y and z m, such that z is _{{2*k}}_ times of x and x is \(1\over _{k}_\) times of y. If the semi-perimeter is equal to _{{((2+2*k+2*k)/2)*j}}_ m, find the area the panel.
